almost everything is phase and will pass eventually we learn language in chucks of discrete sounds and ma ma ma sounds belong to the first group of sounds we communicate naturally first in distress was raised bilingual too so keep in mind that that my bias when brains first learn language they simply connect sense experience or bodily experience with bunch of sounds what language that sound group belongs to is irrelevant so disagree with establishing one language first there is no need to translate one language through another you can simply learn that that thing say tree is both known as tree and arbre just like cold chilly freezing etc can all be used to talk about cold it perfectly possible to naturally and neurally attach groups of sounds to the brain mental picture of tree learning first one language and then translating the second language through the first is actually retarding ie slowing down factor in learning either language and neuroligically unnecessary there may indeed be small delay in correct grammar and vocabulary but it not overwhelming for the child unless an adult is making them feel stressed and overwhelmed about it my 16 month old has about 20 words in her vocabulary dad sissy nose chair dog uh oh hi tons of stuff she uses every day in normal conversation she will only say mama while kicking her legs in her high chair telling me she wants down think my husband does call her honey so maybe she reflecting it back it pretty cute though so like it kids are silly my 13 month old calls both her dad and dada and then used mama as call for help also meaning whoever is around my son first said mama at about eight months to express his displeasure that my husband had gone in with bottle of water during the night rather than me and my boobs for maybe three months mama meant give me milk more than mummy though honestly think to baby they re the same thing but he started to say it in friendly way just before he turned one just sent mod mail
